competitor_advantages.title: Review volume
competitor_advantages.description: Competitor A has 87 reviews vs your 12. Higher review counts signal trust to both users and search engines.

competitor_advantages.title: Service page coverage
competitor_advantages.description: Competitor A covers 8 service categories with dedicated pages vs your 4.

competitor_advantages.title: Local SEO signals
competitor_advantages.description: Competitor A has LocalBusiness structured data and dedicated location pages.

user_strengths.title: SSL and security
user_strengths.description: Your site has proper HTTPS configuration. Competitor B serves mixed content.
evidence: Your site: valid SSL, no mixed content
Competitor B: mixed content warnings detected

user_strengths.title: Review quality
user_strengths.description: Your 4.2 star rating is solid. Focus on volume to complement quality.

gaps.significance: Review count is a strong local ranking factor. 75-review gap is significant.
Missing service pages mean missing search visibility for those terms.

gaps.competitor_value: NAP + Location pages + Schema — Competitor A
gaps.significance: Structured data and location pages strengthen local pack presence.
36-point gap impacts user experience and Core Web Vitals signals.

actions.action: Fix NAP consistency across all pages and directories
actions.why: Inconsistent NAP confuses search engines about your business identity.
actions.estimated_impact: Directional improvement in local pack visibility. This is a foundational signal — inconsistency actively hurts, fixing it removes a penalty rather than adding a boost.
actions.verification_method: Search your business name + city. Verify NAP matches across top 10 directory listings.

actions.action: Add XML sitemap and submit to Search Console
actions.why: Ensures all your pages are discoverable by search engines.
actions.estimated_impact: Pages typically get indexed 2-4 weeks faster with a sitemap. No direct ranking impact, but prerequisite for visibility.
actions.verification_method: Check Google Search Console > Sitemaps for successful submission and indexed page count.

actions.action: Create 4 missing service pages targeting your core offerings
actions.why: You're missing pages for services your competitors rank for.
actions.estimated_impact: Each well-optimized service page can capture relevant search traffic within 4-8 weeks. Impact depends on search volume and competition for those terms.
actions.verification_method: Verify pages are indexed in Search Console. Track impressions for target keywords after 4 weeks.

actions.action: Implement a review solicitation process for recent customers
actions.why: You have a 75-review gap with your top competitor. Reviews are a top local ranking factor.
actions.estimated_impact: Realistic target: 5-10 new reviews per month with active solicitation. Closing the gap fully takes 6-12 months, but even 10-20 new reviews can improve local pack positioning.
actions.verification_method: Track monthly review count on Google Business Profile.

actions.action: Add FAQ schema and LocalBusiness structured data
actions.why: Competitor A has structured data that helps search engines understand their business.
actions.estimated_impact: Rich results eligibility (FAQ snippets, business info in knowledge panel). No guaranteed ranking boost, but improves CTR when appearing in results.
actions.verification_method: Test with Google Rich Results Test tool. Verify no errors.

actions.action: Review Search Console data and adjust content priorities
actions.why: Data from weeks 1-3 will reveal which actions had the most impact.
actions.estimated_impact: No direct ranking impact — this is a measurement and course-correction step.
actions.verification_method: Compare Search Console impressions and clicks week-over-week. Note which new pages are getting impressions.
